intro: Ainsliaea caesia, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet. The plant features showy, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Ainsliaea caesia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
